name: Harvest Moon
description: "When we get to this season," says PDT's Jim Meehan, we switch from white spirits like tequila or white rum to brown ones like rye, and move toward stirred cocktails instead of refreshing, hydrating shaken ones." This fall drink uses Lillet Blanc as a counterweight, picking up the orange flavors and connecting the base spirits to the liqueur and bitters.
recipeIngredient: 3 dashes Abbott's bitters or Angostura bitters

recipeInstructions.text: Stir rye, Lillet Blanc, apple brandy, Chatreuse, and bitters with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with an orange twist.
